bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 49 (Wednesday, March 21, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. POLIS:H.R. 5374.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 3 of section 8 of Article I of the Constitution[Page H1755]

item.text:
Student Non-Discrimination Act of 2018

This bill prohibits discrimination, under a federally assisted program, against public school students on the basis of their actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity or that of their associates.

The bill authorizes federal departments and agencies to terminate the educational assistance of recipients found to be violating this prohibition.

An aggrieved individual may assert a violation of this bill in a judicial proceeding and recover reasonable attorney's fees.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.title: To end discrimination based on actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity in public schools, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
